JavaDoq: JSONHelper.java   
001 package de.general.json;
002 
003 
004 import java.io.*;
005 
006 
007 /**
008  *
009  * @author knauth
010  */
011 class JSONHelper
012 {
013 
014     ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
015     // Constants
016     ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
017 
018     ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
019     // Variables
020     ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
021 
022     ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
023     // Constructors
024     ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
025 
026     ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
027     // Methods
028     ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
029 
030     /**
031      * Produce a string from a Number.
032      *
033      * @param number
034      * A Number
035      * @return A String.
036      * @throws JSONException
037      * If n is a non-finite number.
038      */
039     protected static String numberToString(Number number)
040     {
041         if (number == null) {
042             return "null";
043         }
044         if (!testValidity(number)) {
045             throw new RuntimeException("Can't convert number: " + number);
046         }
047 
048         // Shave off trailing zeros and decimal point, if possible.
049 
050         String string = number.toString();
051         if (string.indexOf('.') > 0 && string.indexOf('e') < 0
052                 && string.indexOf('E') < 0) {
053             while (string.endsWith("0")) {
054                 string = string.substring(0, string.length() - 1);
055             }
056             if (string.endsWith(".")) {
057                 string = string.substring(0, string.length() - 1);
058             }
059         }
060         return string;
061     }
062 
063     /**
064      * Throw an exception if the object is a NaN or infinite number.
065      *
066      * @param o
067      * The object to test.
068      * @throws JSONException
069      * If o is a non-finite number.
070      */
071     protected static boolean testValidity(Object o)
072     {
073         if (o != null) {
074             if (o instanceof Double) {
075                 if (((Double) o).isInfinite() || ((Double) o).isNaN()) {
076                     return false;
077                 }
078             } else if (o instanceof Float) {
079                 if (((Float) o).isInfinite() || ((Float) o).isNaN()) {
080                     return false;
081                 }
082             }
083             return true;
084         }
085         return false;
086     }
087 
088     protected static String quote(String string)
089     {
090         StringWriter sw = new StringWriter();
091         synchronized (sw.getBuffer()) {
092             try {
093                 return quote(string, sw).toString();
094             } catch (IOException ignored) {
095                 // will never happen - we are writing to a string writer
096                 return "";
097             }
098         }
099     }
100 
101    protected static Writer quote(String string, Writer w) throws IOException
102    {
103         if (string == null || string.length() == 0) {
104             w.write("\"\"");
105             return w;
106         }
107 
108         char b;
109         char c = 0;
110         String hhhh;
111         int i;
112         int len = string.length();
113 
114         w.write('"');
115         for (i = 0; i < len; i += 1) {
116             b = c;
117             c = string.charAt(i);
118             switch (c) {
119             case '\\':
120             case '"':
121                 w.write('\\');
122                 w.write(c);
123                 break;
124             case '/':
125                 if (b == '<') {
126                     w.write('\\');
127                 }
128                 w.write(c);
129                 break;
130             case '\b':
131                 w.write("\\b");
132                 break;
133             case '\t':
134                 w.write("\\t");
135                 break;
136             case '\n':
137                 w.write("\\n");
138                 break;
139             case '\f':
140                 w.write("\\f");
141                 break;
142             case '\r':
143                 w.write("\\r");
144                 break;
145             default:
146                 if (c < ' ' || (c >= '\u0080' && c < '\u00a0')
147                         || (c >= '\u2000' && c < '\u2100')) {
148                     w.write("\\u");
149                     hhhh = Integer.toHexString(c);
150                     w.write("0000", 0, 4 - hhhh.length());
151                     w.write(hhhh);
152                 } else {
153                     w.write(c);
154                 }
155             }
156         }
157         w.write('"');
158         return w;
159     }
160 
161 }
